availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Henry S. Jefferson (Mason County, Kentucky, farmer and deputy sheriff)

body.p: Mason County, Kentucky, farmer and deputy sheriff. Kentucky native. Married to Abigail Dawson Jefferson in Mason County on March 2, 1839. Father of Perry Jefferson, John T. Jefferson, and Nancy Jefferson. Farmer in Mason County in 1850. Owned five enslaved persons in Mason County in 1850. Farmer in Mason County in 1860. Owned four enslaved persons in Mason County in 1860. Deputy sheriff in Mason County in 1861.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, District 3, p. 142B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, District 3, p. 762.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, District 2, p. 47.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, District 2, p. 7B.
Marriage Records: Kentucky Marriages, Madison County Courthouse, Mason County, Film #000281843, p. 358 of 515 on microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Find A Grave, "Henry S Jefferson (1818-1866)," Memorial #43246267, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/43246267 (accessed September 11, 2018).
